snippet: The Obama administration secretly gave its blessing to arms shipments to Libyan rebels from Qatar, but American officials grew alarmed at evidence that Qatar was turning some of the weapons over to militants.
abstract: United States officials and foreign diplomats say Obama administration secretly gave its blessing to arms shipments to Libyan rebels from Qatar in 2011, but American officials later grew alarmed as evidence grew that Qatar was turning some of the weapons over to Islamic militants; experience takes on new urgency as US considers whether to play direct role in arming rebels in Syria.

byline.original: By JAMES RISEN, MARK MAZZETTI and MICHAEL S. SCHMIDT
byline.contributor: David D. Kirkpatrick and Kareem Fahim contributed reporting from Cairo.

lead_paragraph: The Obama administration secretly gave its blessing to arms shipments to Libyan rebels from Qatar, but American officials grew alarmed at evidence that Qatar was turning some of the weapons over to militants.

headline.seo: U.S.-Approved Weapons Transfer Ended Up With Libyan Jihadis
headline.main: U.S.-Approved Arms for Libya Rebels Fell Into Jihadis’ Hands
headline.print_headline: Militant Forces Got Arms Meant For Libya Rebels

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject
